intro: Ludia dracaenoides, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slight hairy texture. Ludia dracaenoides is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
